To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getVotingPeriod(address)":{"details":"Check voting period duration based on user grade","params":{"_user":"The address of the user"},"returns":{"_0":"The voting period duration"}},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"hasVoted(uint256,address)":{"details":"Check if a user has voted for a course","params":{"_courseId":"The ID of the course","_voter":"The address of the voter"},"returns":{"_0":"True if the user has voted, false otherwise"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. adjustReputation(uint256,bool).details: Adjust the reputation of a user based on the voting result

params._approved: True if the course is approved, false otherwise

finalizeCourse(uint256).details: Finalize a course by approving or rejecting it

getCourse(uint256).details: Get a course from its ID

getCourses(address).details: Get the courses submitted by a user

getCreator(uint256).details: Get the creator of a course

getCreatorByAddress(address).details: Get the creator of a course

getCreatorNumberOfCourses(address).details: Get the creator number of courses

getNumberOfCourses(address).details: Get the number of courses submitted by a user

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getVotingPeriod(address).details: Check voting period duration based on user grade

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

hasVoted(uint256,address).details: Check if a user has voted for a course

returns._0: True if the user has voted, false otherwise

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

submitCourse(string,string,uint256).details: Submit a course to the collective intelligence

params._ipfsHash: The IPFS hash of the course
params._voteEndTime: The end time of the voting period

params._vote: The vote (true for approve, false for reject)

params._feeCollector: The address of the fee collector
